title: Typography Photography Vol. 3, 10 more great photos of found type
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615125752im_/http:/typophile.com/files/found-type-yoklubi_4291.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615125752im_/http:/typophile.com/files/found-type-distressed-type_5192.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615125752im_/http:/typophile.com/files/found-type-alaska_3675.jpg)

I’ve decided to establish a running feature on my blog that I will call “Typography Photography”. This is kind of like the previous posts about found type photos I have done (see the links at the bottom of the post), but from now on I will try to write a little about each picture instead of just posting them.

To see the rest of the images, and read my thoughts on them, please visit the post on my personal blog:

[Typography Photography Vol. 3, 10 more great photos of found type](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615125752/http:/gentlepurespace.com/blog/archives/typography-photography-3)

Previous versions: [Vol 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615125752/http:/gentlepurespace.com/blog/archives/five-found-type-photos-2) | [Vol 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615125752/http:/gentlepurespace.com/blog/archives/five-found-type-photos)
author: gentlepurespace

comments.content:
those are just beautiful!  
my break is coming up, so i’m hoping to take my camera and go on type-tours around the city.
Nice one! really like the “Distressed Type” image.
If there is ever a good reason not to keep signage in good shape, its beautiful images like these!
Agreed, a well built sign only seems to get more character as it ages
